title: Ticket #3271: Fairly severe priority inversion at Nebraska
description:

remarks:
2012-Oct-16 22:41:24 by bbockelm:
I think I see the issue. In Matchmaker::hgq_fairshare, stage (1), we print the quota and requested for that group. We then calculate the allocated:

group->allocated = std::min(group->requested, group->quota);

and then:

surplus = group->quota - group->allocated;

This is wrong - the quota is the sum of the quota for this group and all its children, but the requested is only the requested from this group. Hence, the surplus is much too large.

I propose something along the lines of the following patch. 

diff --git a/src/condor_negotiator.V6/matchmaker.cpp b/src/condor_negotiator.V6/matchmaker.cpp
index 053c082..2c3587c 100644
--- a/src/condor_negotiator.V6/matchmaker.cpp
+++ b/src/condor_negotiator.V6/matchmaker.cpp
@@ -1848,13 +1848,22 @@ void Matchmaker::hgq_assign_quotas(GroupEntry* group, double quota) {
     dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG, "group quotas: group %s assigned quota= %g\n", group->name.c_str(), group->quota);
 }

+double hgq_get_tree_requested(GroupEntry* group) {
+    double requested = group->requested;
+    for (unsigned long j = 0;  j < group->children.size();  ++j) {
+        GroupEntry* child = group->children[j];
+        requested += hgq_get_tree_requested(child);
+    }
+    return requested;
+}

 double Matchmaker::hgq_fairshare(GroupEntry* group) {
-    dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG, "group quotas: fairshare (1): group= %s  quota= %g  requested= %g\n",
-            group->name.c_str(), group->quota, group->requested);
+    double initial_subtree_requested = hgq_get_tree_requested(group)
+    dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG, "group quotas: fairshare (1): group= %s  quota= %g  requested= %g subtree_requested= %g\n",
+            group->name.c_str(), group->quota, group->requested, initial_subtree_requested);

     // Allocate whichever is smallest: the requested slots or group quota.
-    group->allocated = std::min(group->requested, group->quota);
+    group->allocated = std::min(initial_subtree_requested, group->quota);

     // update requested values
     group->requested -= group->allocated;

2012-Oct-17 11:56:25 by bbockelm:
Another case: 

10/17/12 11:20:08 group quotas: group= <none>  cquota= 0  static= 0  accept= 1  quota= 3078  req= 0  usage= 0
10/17/12 11:20:08 group quotas: group= cms  cquota= 0.9  static= 0  accept= 1  quota= 2770.2  req= 0  usage= 0
10/17/12 11:20:08 group quotas: group= other  cquota= 0.1  static= 0  accept= 1  quota= 307.8  req= 1127  usage= 874
10/17/12 11:20:08 group quotas: group= other.hcc  cquota= 1  static= 0  accept= 1  quota= 307.8  req= 0  usage= 0
(removing the other CMS stuff)

The code will correctly determine other that group other has zero surplus. Then it recurses to other.hcc and determine it has a surplus of 307.8. It then adds that surplus to the parent group, so the group gets a total quota of 615.6.

I think the code doesn't clearly distinguish between "quota" and "subtree quota". In the above example, other should have a quota of zero, but has a subtree quota of 307.8.

2012-Oct-17 16:57:55 by eje:
I need more detailed context on the current configuration and the desired/expected behavior.

Can you attach the config, and/or define how to log into red-condor.unl.edu?

2012-Oct-18 14:21:11 by eje:
The problem appears to be changing default of NEGOTIATOR_ALLOW_QUOTA_OVERSUBSCRIPTION from False to True on #3040

When using dynamic quotas, should set: 

NEGOTIATOR_ALLOW_QUOTA_OVERSUBSCRIPTION = False

We may want to revisit that default value. Fermi is the only customer I'm aware of who uses oversubscribed quotas.
